title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro made a brief appearance as goalie after Joonas Korpisalo was pulled due to a possible concussion.
DiPietro played 6:03 for the Bruins, stopping two shots before Korpisalo returned to finish the game.
Head coach Marco Sturm praised both goalies after the 4-2 win over the Columbus Blue Jackets.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, of Manchester, N.H., arrested for reckless second-degree murder in her baby's death.
The infant, named 'Baby Jane Doe', was found dead in Pine Island Pond on March 27, 2025.
Investigation into the incident continues, and a $5,000 reward was offered for information in April 2025.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner found black transmission fluid; a drain and refill was recommended over a flush.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek's dealer recommended $1,600 repairs including TPMS sensors and control arm bushings.
A 2018 GMC Denali owner advised to monitor antifreeze levels as evaporation might occur, with common leak areas identified.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham was evacuated due to roof structural stress from heavy snow accumulation.
Students were relocated to Hingham High School for safety, with lunch and transportation home provided.
Hingham experienced over 17 inches of snow during Monday's blizzard, causing the structural concerns.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz has softened his stance on Rafael Devers after criticizing his defense and fitness in 2025.
Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants following conflicts over his position and refusal to switch roles.
Ortiz expressed continued support for Devers, calling him a great player and wishing him success in San Francisco.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that destroyed a home and injured two residents.
Explosion at 78 Plain St. in Taunton injured a 25-year-old mother and her 2-year-old daughter.
Community fundraisers raised over $33,000 for affected families following the devastating explosion and fire.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 in the 2026 NFLPA report card, an improvement from previous years.
Significant issues include outdated travel resources, particularly a poorly rated team plane, and low-quality food services.
The Patriots are opening a new facility for the 2026 season to address shortcomings in the weight room, training room, and practice fields.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, a Malden teacher, was arraigned on charges of raping an 18-year-old student in foster care.
Marino, 54, was arrested and charged with two counts of rape and indecent assault on a person 14 or over.
He was released on $75,000 bail with conditions including GPS monitoring and was put on leave by Malden schools.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assault and battery after a Springfield traffic stop on Jan. 3, court records show.
Daoust allegedly used physical force and pepper spray on a driver during a stop for speeding and lane violations.
State Police suspended Daoust without pay; he has a history of prior disciplinary actions from 2015 and 2017.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey announced the rollout of a ChatGPT AI assistant for nearly 40,000 executive branch employees.
65% of over 100 readers surveyed opposed the AI initiative, citing concerns about security, privacy, and environmental impact.
Healey plans to provide free Google AI training to all Massachusetts residents, aiming to boost innovation and workforce skills.
